website_summaries.verdict: A sound choice if you are looking for an eco-friendly diaper and don't mind changing them frequently to prevent leaks.
pros: Made of bamboo that is soft and less likely to cause rashes and allergic reactions
cons: They might not hold up for extended hours between changes, and tend to sag

customer_reviews.title: Not happy....
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers because they are biodegradable and no dyes extra perfumes and minerals and when I started buying them they were about $60 for 180 and now there are nearly $100 for an 180 how can it go up almost $30 or more and a one month. I understand that this subscribe and Save deal but I've been doing the subscribe and save for over a year now I think I should get a little bit more of a price break. And for it to go up $20 every month it's kind of hard to budget for diapers that you need for your baby's butt especially when you want to have good quality suck of thus brand.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: From $63 to $91! What has changed for these diapers to now be worth almost $30 more?? Nothing.
customer_reviews.text: I really love these diapers and have used them for three years when I haven't cloth diapered. I made the switch back to disposables and have been buying these for the last few months, but it looks like the price has been increasing dramatically. For that I give this product 3 stars, I feel like I'm being seriously ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Diapers changed?
customer_reviews.text: We used these diapers for our first child born in 2015. They were great and we used them up until she was potty trained. They were great night time diapers and we were amazed at how well they absorbed wetness. With our second daughter we have been using them since July and they have been disappointing. They don’t absorb wetness and many times she has “blown” out. She wakes up in the night soaked because these diapers can’t absorb enough liquid. Not sure but it seems they changed their diapers. These diapers were so soft and so absorbent before. I am very disappointed and will be canceling my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Not real Bambo diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have used bambo nature for a while now and ordered these for the convenience of the amount of diapers But they look soo fake to me the letters on the packaging are blurry they just don’t seem real at all ! I am returning them I won’t risk using them Looking at the pictures of other reviews after I received my order The diapers themselves look completely different These diapers are Fake ! Do not buy !
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD TREJO

customer_reviews.title: All Natural is Good But This Diaper Still Has Some Issues
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -All natural -No rash/sensitivity issue -Subscription shipping available Cons: -Leak during night-can't make it through an entire night of no diaper changes. Leaks even w/ my 4 week old. -Sticks horribly to baby's skin like a bandaid if there's the slightest bit of poop present (my baby is exclusively breastfed, not sure if formula-fed babies have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Mama

customer_reviews.title: I don't think they're the real Bambo brand
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these from Amazon to "try" them out...was quite surprised that Bambo reviews were so high because what we received were terrible. They literally felt like cardboard out the package...because I just couldn't imagine that people would rate these better than Honest diapers...I looked at the Bambo website and notice the package for the same size was different and the image of the diaper was different...so, I thought did I get a generic??? Anyway, ordered a pack directly from Bambo and they arrived today...immediately...I feel a world of difference...so looking forward to trying my pack out... Not sure though if what I received was generic🤔
customer_reviews.author: William Childs

customer_reviews.title: Fine for #1, TERRIBLE for #2
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. I purchased bulk quantities of size 1,2, and 3 and at each stage there is consistently side leakage with bowel movements and many up the back blowouts. Diapers are decent for just pee, but not worth the frequent poopy messes. SO. MUCH. EXTRA. LAUNDRY. Because I can count on there ALWAYS being poop leakage I have to buy another brand for going out. Can’t wait until I’m done with our stock so I can move on with my life.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Liked these the Least
customer_reviews.text: For our baby showers we received Honest, Seventh Generation, Pampers, and Huggies diapers plus had also bought Thrive, Hello Bello & Bambo diapers. The Bambo pack we bought was “Newborn 4-9lbs” and they are so HUGE we had to wait until he was 5 weeks old (9 lbs. 1oz.) before using them. But the cut is so wide, what baby has legs that far apart from each other?? I can imagine they were not comfortable for him. They’re not absorbent so my baby actually cried when his diaper was wet versus never caring with the other brands. And one night he woke up wet up his back through his swaddle.
customer_reviews.author: FoxyRoxy

customer_reviews.title: Finally a diaper for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 month old has eczema and very sensitive skin. Every diaper we've previously tried has either given him a diaper rash or made the eczema worse where it touches his skin. Pampers pure was the worst - looked like it burned his bottom! We tried several of the more natural options (babyganics, naty, andypandy) and these are by far our favorite. Great absorbency and leak protection. Nice and soft, and not at all flimsy feeling. And the best part of course is that they don't cause diaper rash or irritate his skin in any way! They even last overnight without leaks or rash! Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbant
customer_reviews.text: Knock on wood, my stomach sleeper boy has never had a leak in these over 12+ hour nights. I like that they're "natural" too, though I'm not sure how much that really matters. Their website explains how technically you can compost them if you take them to the right place, which at least makes me feel better that they're made from materials that break down eventually into something safe! I also prefer their sizing - which seems weird compared to most US diaper sizing - but works better for my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: businessmom

customer_reviews.title: Love these diapers. Runs small on our son's round little body
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Bambo since our 6 month old was born. We absolutely love them. He sleeps 11 hours overnight and has a very tiny leak about once every 3 weeks. He is currently 21 lbs and in size 4 (15-40lbs). I will be ordering size 5 next time for 24-55lbs. We haven't been experiencing any significant leaks with the 4s. When it does happen, it's in the front after overnight, and he's a belly sleeper. We have not had any leaks in the back, however, it looks to me that he should have more material there. It doesn't look wide enough for his round little body lol Hoping the 5s will be better for booty coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: leaks leaks leaks
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for 2 years and 2 of my kids. I'm not sure if the company switched manufacturing or something, but the diapers are super thin, stretch around the legs are no longer there which cause a lot of leaks. I'm going through these diapers every 30min to an hour because of the leaks, and don't even talk about the laundry because of the wet pants. Will not be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W Sung

customer_reviews.title: Poorly sized and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after a search for pull up night diapers for my youngest, hoping they’d be a stopgap until we figure out his bedwetting issues. First of all, the size 6 isn’t a pull up, as expected, so it was more embarrassing for him to put on. Second, my kid is tall and slender, and far below the weight limit for these diapers. They’re incredibly long, but barely fit over his hips. He said they’re uncomfortable and don’t stay in place. I was hoping, given his sensitive skin, that these would help, but it’s clear after one use, I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Never

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite diaper!
customer_reviews.text: These are the ONLY diapers I have found that do not give my daughter a chemical rash/burn. And I have tried a lot of different brands!!! They work great for night time too! If your kiddo gets rashes from all other diapers, you should give these a try! It is worth the extra cost to avoid the rashes and burns.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: No Wetness Indicator Strip
customer_reviews.text: I have tried both the Andy Pandy brand and the Bambo Nature brand after my son was born but stuck with the Andy Pandy brand because I like the wetness indicator strip on the Andy Pandy brand. I recently revisited the Bambo Nature because my boy is kinda between sized on the Andy Pandy brand right now so I orered a pack of 30 Bambo Nature brand because I heard they now have wet indicator strips. Well, to be honest I just can't live without the indicator strips and the new diapers to not have indicator strips. So back to the Andy Pandy's.
customer_reviews.author: Max M.

customer_reviews.title: My all time favorite diaper!
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers! They’ve worked wonders for my family and I love how soft they are and how eco-friendly they are as well. Any baby can leak out of diapers. Honestly, I would just be smart about how you use any diaper brand. Don’t give your baby a gallon of water or milk right before bed. They will pee and fill up any diaper. I would rate these diapers as my all time favorite, honest company next or 7th generation and then then your general grocery store brands they usually have like pampers/ huggies.... I’ve tried them all and have found what works for us. We love this brand!
customer_reviews.author: NikkiO

customer_reviews.title: Decent - But Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I like these because of the lack of chemicals and the fact they are made with fairly natural materials. I wish the absorbency was a little better, but I guess you cannot have the best of both worlds. I use them during the day and use another natural brand at night that is more absorbant. They are expensive but if you are looking for something natural, they are pretty good for daytime diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Erica DePietro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do this to your poor baby’s butt
customer_reviews.text: My poor little guy got the worst diaper rash I’ve ever seen with these diapers. They suffer from the dual uselessness of not absorbing liquid baby poop and also sticking horribly to their skin as soon as they get wet. So every time we removed one (even with diaper cream on, and even moments after he had gone) we had to peel it away and then scrub off dried poop, leaving raw, painful patches all over his tiny butt. They are so expensive that we tried to use every one, changing them immediately after he pooped. His bum is still recovering.
customer_reviews.author: Jen K.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but the best performing diapers we've tried
customer_reviews.text: Not only the best performing environmentally friendly diaper, but the best performing diaper in general. My kiddo has super sensitive skin, and I want to be as environmentally conscious as I can be using disposables. The only combination we have discovered that does not lead to a rash are these diapers with water wipes. These things are so absorbent they work better than the huggies for bedtime as well. I have tried Honest, 7th gen, Pampers, Huggies, Luvs, Kroger Generic brand, Walmart generic brand, Safeway generic brand. This diaper is amazingly absorbent, doesn't leak. Been using them for my 25 pound 8 month old since he was a couple months old, and we will keep using them!
customer_reviews.author: Whimsyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Worst blow-outs ever
customer_reviews.text: Way too wide around the waist and no elastic band so constantly leaking poo up baby's back! No other diaper I tried had this many blowouts, I went through more outfits with these Bambos... not to mention the carseat, the baby carrier, the baby bouncer and the swing that all needed to be cleaned multiple times. Also in need of a wetness-indicator line. Only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is props for being more environmentally friendly than the mega-brand diapers. But it still needs to work, and these don't.
customer_reviews.author: kmacel

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.text: They are way too big for even a 10lb baby. They need to be folded over to fit my 10 lb granddaughter. They leak something awful. They don't hold much pee or poo before they start leaking. My daughter absolutely HATES them. I'd bought them for her based on the reviews but also bought her the "mama bear" too, They are wonderful. So, using the bamboo brand after the mama bear really highlighted how bad they are.
customer_reviews.author: sk-cjg - NH

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST diaper that everyone should know
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST diaper that I have finally found! Tried most all natural, better, organic, etc diapers but I ended up with Bambo Nature. Keeps dry like completely dry inside in the morning after absorbing approximately 3 full urination. So far had 3 times of leakage (for the past 4 months) but had more frequent leakage with all other brands that I tried. Anyways, highly recommend to everybody and I am personally very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Seungbong C.

customer_reviews.title: Are these knockoff diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the bambo new born, size 1 and 2 loved them. They were all consistent in Design, quality and softness, just had this size 3 delivered and I legitimately thought they were fake. They feel terrible, aren’t as good as the ones I had previously. Would t buy again and going to return these
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Beat honest company and seventh generation overnights
customer_reviews.text: Really, really absorbent! Held up overnight when honest company overnights stopped cutting it and seventh generation overnights didn't stand a chance. Kid weighs about 25lbs and size 5 of these bamboo diapers fit perfectly. We had him in a size 6 honest company overnight diaper and this is way better and has not yet soaked through!! His skin is very sensitive and I have not noticed any issues after using almost the entire pack of diapers. Will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen S. Diego

customer_reviews.title: Soft!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I just tried them and didn’t realize they weren’t for babies that weighed 11 lbs but my daughter used them without an issue. They’re so soft and feel like they’re well made unlike the other brand we used. It is reassuring to know we are using better materials and helping the environment in a way.
customer_reviews.author: courteney

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and covered in poo
customer_reviews.text: We tried these after reading (BabyGearLab's disposable diaper review)[]. They rated this brand as their top pick, but I have to assume that the article predates the change that other reviewers are pointing out. We've had nothing but leaking and blow-outs with these. I far prefer the (Nature Babycare)[] diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Banana Pancakes

customer_reviews.title: Trying to switch from pampers diapers to this. We've ...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to switch from pampers diapers to this. We've had multiple diaper leaks. The stretchy park is not as robust as pampers so urine/stool will leak on to clothes. Also, there's no visual indicator other than feel that diaper is soiled. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: No leaks. No rashes. Eco Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for more than a year, and they are wonderful diapers. Size up if your kid has meaty upper thighs, though. Don't be afraid to try one and if it doesn't work, you can return and say it didn't fit your child (obviously, do this only if it's true!) Pampers caused diaper rash and always had a weird chemical smell. Honest Company leaks like crazy as does Earth. I love these and have recommended to all friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cultivate Magic

customer_reviews.title: Bambo Natural Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these, as I try to be as natural as possible for my family with food, hygiene items, etc. I read older reviews that left me a bit unsure, but these diapers are great. The only thing I noticed, mine do not have a wetness indicator. Some pictures here show diapers with an indicator, and I believe I read that there is supposed to be one. It is easy to tell if a diaper is even slightly puffy, so it is not a big concern. Highly recommended, especially since they are biodegradable!
customer_reviews.author: LindseyK26

customer_reviews.title: Will never use any other diaper
customer_reviews.text: We went from cloth diapers to Bambo diapers, and have been using these for almost a year and a half. I change my son as often as other people change their little ones who wear Pampers and Huggies, so they're just as absorbent as the bigger brands. The only time they've ever leaked was at night when it got too full, and it was a very small amount of pee. I started sizing up at night and that solved the problem. My son has had 1 diaper rash in his entire life, and it was very mild. I feel better about using these diapers for environmental reasons, and because of fewer chemicals on my baby's skin.
customer_reviews.author: Bigredgirl

customer_reviews.title: like heaven on a baby's butt
customer_reviews.text: Never have I loved a diaper as much as I have loved this diaper. They are like a wholesome security blanket around my baby's soft little bum. I put him in them at night and they don't leak. What??!!! I KNOW!! SO RAD!!! And when we go out and about, I make sure he has one of these on so I don't run into that "oh, what a warm sensation. wait, my baby just peed though his diaper" predicament. They have saved me many a midnight crisis situation with their heavenly absorbent goodness. Thank-you BAMBO!
customer_reviews.author: Frankie and Chet

customer_reviews.title: Love these diapers
customer_reviews.text: We've never had a blowout that was a result of these diapers. We use at night because cloth diapers don't cut it for us. Babies with sensitive skin do well. If you have any challenges, a little "air time" is very helpful, and can happen in the bathtub. I don't think any diaper will solve that issue entirely. Overall: Absolutely no complaints after a year of using these. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Good for sensitive skin BUT blowout sucks :(
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old baby boy has very sensitive skin. These diapers seem dont trigger any allergies or rashness on his butt and thighs so far. Very comfortable and soft cotton inner line compared to Pampers swaddlers and pure.Absorbency is not bad. No fragrances too. So we are using size 4 to avoid blowouts but it is not working out well. He keeps having Side blowouts and on his back most of the time when he pooped. Overall its a good classic diapers for sensitive skin if you dont mind about the blowouts. But im going to change to other brand
customer_reviews.author: Budnyam

customer_reviews.title: Size 3 leaks terribly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these since my little one was born - size 1 and 2 were perfect. Size 3 has been terrible!! They leak more than half of the time. I’d return them, but I bought a case and embarrassingly, I keep expecting the next pack to be better, but we are 3/4 of the way though the case and no such luck. It’s a shame that they leak so badly because otherwise I love them and would continue buying/recommending them!
customer_reviews.author: cookieb90

customer_reviews.title: Old is WAY better than new!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this in store, however the package looked different and it turned out to be the worst diaper ever. I was so super confused as to why it had such high ratings until I further researched that in store was the new "improved" version. I saw other reviews that also made it clear how terrible the new ones were compared to these old original ones. If you're interested in bamboo nature. Stick with these and not the white package ones
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Osiadacz

customer_reviews.title: VERY IMPRESSED! I was skeptical
customer_reviews.text: I only purchased a small pack to try. my baby girl has such sensitive skin that I have to bathe her every diaper change instead of wiping. Ive tried so many brands from 7th generation to Honest and the walmart brand, abby&finn, dyper etc. This is so far the most comfortable diaper ive had! it feels like fabric and the fit covers so well!!! and its soft!! Im super impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Erate

customer_reviews.title: The Best Diapers, and I have tried THEM ALL
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old makes mincemeat out of just about every diaper he has ever met. Huggies were an unmitigated disaster (as a newborn). Pampers did okay until he was about 2 months old and then every movement was a massive blowout. Earth's Plus are eco friendly but didn't do a better job than the Pampers. Honest are the cutest, of course, and eco friendly, but more expensive and not any better than the Pampers. The Pampers Extra Protection and the Bambo Nature are the only two diapers of which he hasn't made an absolute mockery. They don't have the chemicals which pseudoscientists scare us about, and they are biodegradable. But most importantly, they contain the mess consistently!
customer_reviews.author: MissMare

customer_reviews.title: Contains bio-hazardous materials in domestic settings
customer_reviews.text: Our small child defecates into this product regularly. It works as a containment barrier between clothes; which are expected to stay clean, and the child’s sewage-factory terminus. This product works for it’s purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Christofer

customer_reviews.title: No chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers for my daughter. Was originally purchasing these from the supermarket in NY however there sizes stopped at 5 and she now needs a 6. Love that they have no chemical smell when it is soiled like other popular brands. These diapers hold her over through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Infamous one

customer_reviews.title: Excellent leak protection & no diaper rash with original Bambo diapers (green bag)
customer_reviews.text: This is the product I have used for my child for almost two years. No leaks, with the only exception being when my child needed to move up in sizes. Never an issue with diaper rash, either. I have been extremely happy with the product, and it's nice to know it's a bit better for the environment too. The original design in the green bag is far superior to the redesigned product in white bags, in my experience. I hope the manufacturer listens to its customers and continues to make these!
customer_reviews.author: Zip00021

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper for quality and sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these (this one without the wetness indicator definitely performs better leak-wise than the wetness indicator version!). I’ve tried so many types of eco friendly diapers and this one is sturdy, great absorbency (so much better than 7th generation or honest company diapers) and I rarely if ever see any skin irritation as compared to the other brands. Plus these are compostable and very well priced when buying in bulk. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah h green

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best disposable diaper on the market?
customer_reviews.text: We use only use disposable diapers as an overnight solution that's not too bulky and had been using pampers but the weight of knowing they don't biodegrade made us switch to these which we actually like better than pampers. Better quality, they don't get as bulky and weighed down as Pampers do overnight either. Definitely sticking with using these bamboo diapers for over nights.
customer_reviews.author: Fam Huynh

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Other natural diapers gave my son skin problems, but this one has been great. It does smell a little like chemicals or something, but Bambo Nature assured me their diapers have no added chemicals. I like how all the ingredients are listed
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Bambo diapers are just as good as the best Pampers and Huggies but more environmentally friendly. My wife and I love these diapers and have been loyal customers since we discovered them (and we have 2 kids). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: deeaygo

customer_reviews.title: Best eco friendly disposable diaper
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is cloth diapered, but when we go on vacation we use diposables. Pampers, Huggies, and Luvs have all blistered her delicate bum. I bought these to test out before our upcoming vacation and I'm happy to report that our tiny delicate bum has been rash free. Even tested overnight and it held in all the night pee without leaks. I will continue to purchase this brand and I definately recommend to anyone who had a little one with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Meg-meglio

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these diapers. We have used babyganics, honest, seventh generation, and targets new brand, as well as pampers swaddlers. Bambos have the best absorbancy and the best fit. We go through them at half the pace of other diapers. They don’t stink like honest and they are wider so no creepers or lopsided fit. They are the softest natural diapers I’ve used, too. I’ve never been so excited about a diaper. I wish I had started with this brand and not waited until size 5 to switch :( they are definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Stiff
customer_reviews.text: Love that these are environmentally friendly but they’re so stiff and uncomfortable feeling! I know that’s the trade off for a biodegradable diaper but I still prefer Eco by Naty because they’re just a little softer on my babe.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Antolino

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: I liked these diapers except for the fact that I found a few bead like spongy things on baby's legs. I don't use these at night because I am not too sure if they would hold up. I don't get why some packages have a price variance with different quantities. I would like to order 3 boxes at a time - however the cost of 1 box is lesser - doesn't really make sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: Poonam

customer_reviews.title: My favorite natural diaper
customer_reviews.text: We primarily use cloth diapers, but occasionally use disposables when we're out and about and overnight. We've tried every brand of "natural" disposable diaper around: Honest Co, Seventh Generation, Babyganics. Bambo are our favorite. They never leak and seem extremely dry when we take them off, even after he wears them overnight (11 hours). My son is very prone to diaper rash, and this diaper keeps the moisture off his skin very well; he doesn't get diaper rash as much when wearing Bambos overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Trillium03

customer_reviews.title: All night no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best non toxic eco friendly diapers I have found, and I have tried them all. They are the best for the environment because they are 100% biodegradable. No plastic/polyester at all. I love knowing that something my daughter wears all day and night is completely free of toxins. My daughter will sleep 8-10 hours in this and it only starts to leak after 10+ hours. The diaper is soft and leaves no irritation on her skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having issues with diapers giving my 8 month old a rash. I’ve tried about ever diaper in the store without luck. I got these online and I’m shocked at how absorbent they are! So far, the diaper rash has stayed away so I’m hopeful I’ve found a solution!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Montis

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.text: A friend introduced me to this diaper brand for my newborn and I've been purchasing them ever since. I received other brands at the shower that we tried, but they all caused itchiness and crying. We had some leaks early on and now use a larger size overnight. I continue to buy them because they are not as bad for the environment and my toddler's only complaint now is not being able to wear the size up cause those have fun animals on them. As the title suggests, I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jena SD

customer_reviews.title: These are great diapers-- but Amazon delivery is inconsistent!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this brand of diaper since our baby was a newborn, and we love them! The only consistent problem we've had is with Amazon delivery. We attempted to have a subscription service, however, Amazon has cancelled it unexpectedly for unclear reasons. So we began ordering a la carte, foregoing the subscription discount... and even then we've had orders go missing, or like one of our more recent shipments only delivered half of the diapers we ordered... So we went directly to Bambo Natural's website to set up a subscription-- and guess what: It's cheaper! So spare yourself the headache of ordering from Amazon where it's more expensive and the delivery is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Out of every non-cloth diaper I tried for any of my 2 children these were the best. My son had such sensitive skin that all the typical brands would leave him with chemical burns. In the end I reluctantly (I’m a full time working mom) cloth diapered him, but when that wasn’t an option these did great. If they aren’t cost-prohibitive for you I firmly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: hdcollins85

customer_reviews.title: Really cool diapers, but are unreasonably expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is great, but we switched to other diapers because of the price. We used them at night, when the baby’s stool had not yet taken shape and needed high-quality protection against leaks. It was also important for us to have the quality of the material so that delicate baby skin does not shed. These diapers perfectly matched our wishes. Later we found a cheaper analogue that works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lyna

customer_reviews.title: The best diaper on the market! At least in my baby's opinion
customer_reviews.text: I tried several different diapers (Huggies, Pampers, others) on my daughter and she always got fussy after using them for a short time, along with rashes that would form after using other diaper brands. Just going potty once or twice and she was fussing. Ordered these at random because I wanted to test out different brands of diapers and she loved Bambo Nature diapers. These did not cause any rashes and she does not get fussy after going potty a couple of times, nor did these diapers leak even after they were full or close to being full. Will definitely stick with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Merely?!

customer_reviews.title: I still like how well these diapers perform combined with the eco ...
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are huge for newborns! I didn't know that the Bambo premature diapers were actually newborn size. It's misleading labeling. Danish babies must be huge! lol. I still like how well these diapers perform combined with the eco friendliness. Too bad they are getting more expensive and difficult to get a hold of (depending on size) An indicator strip would be nice, since these diapers keep baby so dry, but butt squishes it is!
customer_reviews.author: K. Neuzil

customer_reviews.title: Very leaky
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are AWFUL. we've been using bambo diapers for a few years with our first child. Ordered these for our baby and they leak terribly. The diaper itself wont be very full, yet his clothes are all wet. The last thing you need is a newborn that needs complete outfit/blanket changes multiple times a night. Very dissapointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: JeBohling

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I didn't learn about these diapers until my son was on size 3. I tried Pampers, Huggies, Kirkland's and these have been the BEST so far. No strong chemical smell! I actually feel good about these safe diapers. My son has NEVER even had diaper rash. These are soft, way softer than Honest brand diapers. Customer service was amazing. They 2 day shipped me two different sizes to sample and that saved money and time :) try these out! Contact customer service. You won't regret these diapers and they're safe for your child.
customer_reviews.author: CharityLMG

customer_reviews.title: The BEST diapers! We have tried a lot of other ...
customer_reviews.text: The BEST diapers! We have tried a lot of other "green" diaper brands (and some not so green brands) and Bambo Nature is clearly the best when it comes to leak protection. My 8 month old is a pretty heavy wetter and sleeps 12 hours at night with no problems. The diaper is completely saturated in the morning, but my baby stays dry and isn't waking up with leaks like he did with Honest diapers, Earth's Best brands and even the highly rated Pamper's Swaddlers brands. I will continue to use Bambo as long as my little one is in diapers.
customer_reviews.author: denvergirl

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but expensive!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on diapers, and saw how highly rated these were. They do absorb well, better than Pampers, I think. But, they don't absorb well enough for the higher price. They are a great option if you are looking for diapers that absorb great that are natural. The shape of the diapers is more wide than long, and the leg opening is a little weird. If I were rich, I'd probably keep buying these. But! Pampers work well enough for me, and I'm not insistent on a natural diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: bam-poo leaks
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these diapers to work. Daily, epic blowouts from the back and sides (despite great diapering technique and accurate sizing) with my ~12lb 2 month old convinced me that there is some issue with poop absorption. Containment of pee was great, but the consistent faint smell of urine (owing to the diaper's natural, fragrance-free construction?) was off-putting. Again, wish that these did the trick, but I'll be continuing my search for eco-friendly diapers.
customer_reviews.author: roxie

customer_reviews.title: Check sizes!
customer_reviews.text: The sizes of these diapers do not match standard US sizes. I didn't pay close attention and bought a size 1 pack thinking it would be the same size as every other size 1 diaper, but no. They are newborn size. We actually need size 3. This is of course my own fault and not that of the manufacturer. I'm just pointing it out so you don't make the same mistake! Because of course, I opened them before I realized and now I'm stuck with an expensive pack of diapers I can't use. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Kay

customer_reviews.title: Will buy as long as needed
customer_reviews.text: Great product for your baby and for your planet! Soft and super absorbent. My only issue is that they run really big-the difference between these NB size and other NB size is pretty significant but you can adjust them of course. I use cloth diapers at home but while out and about I wanted and easier alternative that was eco friendly so this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Great eco friendly diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are great, eco friendly diapers. We've tried many bamboo diapers and these, along with their sensitive option, are easily my favorite. Minimal leaks, soft, non-irritating. And they don't adhere to baby's skin like other brands do. Price is pretty reasonable, too.
customer_reviews.author: jls

customer_reviews.title: READ ABOUT THESE DIAPERS, they are really good!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love bambo diapers, I was using honest and my baby would leak. I used seventh generation and did not like how smelly and rough they were leaving markings on my baby. Bambo is the best diaper all around, it's not the cheapest because its a quality and eco friendly item but if you do a monthly subscription the price will drop and you'll be using a great item for your baby. I even stopped buying overnight diapers from other brands and use these at night as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for smaller newborns - don’t believe the weight range!!!
customer_reviews.text: After running out of the Pamper Swaddler P-1 diapers for our 5.5 lb infant, I ordered these because they advertised fitting 4-9lb infants; however, these are WAY too large for smaller newborns and larger than the newborn size swaddlers we had as a backup. Very disappointed as I wouldn’t have purchased them otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: these diapers are great at everything except holding urine
customer_reviews.text: they look great and fit great (we have a 99+ percentile-sized toddler, so not many size 6s fit her ... and she's taking her sweet time potty training), but they barely hold one large pee. DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT OVERNIGHT. i was very disappointed. i was/am looking for a replacement for natys, which now barely close around my daughter's waist (why do the naty velcro receiving strips on the front not extend farther around to the hips?!? but that's for another review.) these diapers hold even less than the bambo pull-ups. glad i only bought two bags to try.
customer_reviews.author: kikipedia

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used these diapers for over a year since birth and I won't even bother trying anything else. I am very conscientious of everything I feed and expose to my baby so these diapers fit the bill as being chemical free. Though they are pricey, they are still priced very reasonable and they definitely do a great job. The diapers absorb extremely well. My little one has gotten diaper rash only three times in the first year and that was always due to frequent very wet #2s. I trust this company over all those other cheaper diaper brands so I will be sticking with this company for our next baby.
customer_reviews.author: MountainDad

customer_reviews.title: Good absorbency
customer_reviews.text: I like these diapers (not for me, obviously. for my kid!). They don't cause diaper rash, are fragrance-free, and seem to be one of the more natural diapers on the market. If they weren't so expensive, I'd have my kid in them all the time. Instead, we just use these for nighttime, as they have superior absorbency for the size compared to other "natural" diapers.
customer_reviews.author: lw4692

customer_reviews.title: Like several other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Started using these when baby was about 8 pounds, as indicated on the package. Like several other reviewers, we started having blowouts that had never occurred when using Pampers. Stains everywhere, on her onesies, on the swing, tons of laundry being done, what a pain in the butt. However, now that our little girl is over 10 pounds, the blowouts have stopped. So these work perfectly well in a very limited weight range, but you may want to stick with size one until baby is close to 10 pounds. Now that we are getting closer to the upper weight limit, we are unsure when the switch up to the next size or whether to buy another case of this size.
customer_reviews.author: KatclimberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers
customer_reviews.text: I really like these diapers. We had been using Seventh Generation which we also liked, but I've read online that these are slightly more biodegradable so I think it's worth the extra money. They are more full than Seventh Gen in the morning after going all night without a change, but havent had a leak yet. Size 3 fits our average weight/length, 8 month old baby. Seems comparable with the Seventh Gen sizes. And I like that they are plain white.
customer_reviews.author: KatieRose

customer_reviews.title: Used this brand for most of kid's babyhood
customer_reviews.text: great on the baby skin, love that it doesn't have any scent, it doesn't leak, love the simple design. One of the two brands I ever used for my kids. Coincidentally they are both Scandinavian brands, they seem to get the importance of simplicity and pureness when it comes to a baby. No chemicals, no fuss, biodegradable, good on everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Merls

customer_reviews.title: Paid more for worse diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan. Had high expectations since it was advertised as contains more cotton, soft, organic material and environmental friendly. However, it was not soft inside and outside. When touched outside of the diaper, it feels like more plastic than cotton. It is not as absorbent as pampers or Huggies. What’s worse is that, it is more expensive than those two brands, but still not better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of these diapers. I used for my four-year-old and I am now using it for my new baby. With my four-year-old she managed to wear these diapers for 2 1/2 years and never had a diaper rash associated with using the diapers. So long as you use the right size there are very minimum blowouts. With my youngest daughter who is now three months we have yet to have a blowout with these diapers. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: natlaw01

customer_reviews.title: Too soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These daipers spoiled my little one they are so soft he would smile laugh and wiggle when he got his daiper changes. I got them to try out but can't afford to get on a regular basis. The price is reasonable for how soft they are and that they are natural. He was so disappointed to go back to regular daipers. Don't have to deal with rashes either with these. I would definitely recommend this product for babies with sensitive skin. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Vital

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around diapers
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers! Eva has been using primarily cloth since she was born but we use bamboo nature at bedtime and on trips and I haven't found another diaper yet that compares. I rate these diapers high in all categories, they're more environmentally friendly than any I've found, they are comfortable and flexible and soft, and they contain Big messes and can hold alot of liquid. Occasionally we have a leak at night but its just when Eva gets to really thrashing in her bed and the diaper gets twisted sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Katidid

customer_reviews.title: Bad Leaks Overnight :(
customer_reviews.text: My little guy is potty trained, so I bought these diapers only for overnight use. He is 2, but only 25lbs, and often stays dry overnight. I say this to point out that he doesn't produce large amounts of urine in the night. Still, these diapers have leaked nearly every time he pees. Since this is the second morning in a row I've had to wake up early and strip his bed, I'm motivated to write the review. Too bad about these...I'm having a lot of trouble finding a chlorine free overnight diaper :(
customer_reviews.author: AmazonWoman

customer_reviews.title: Why No Litmus Line?!
customer_reviews.text: We first tried Bambo's preemie size and loved them. That was the only "clean" diaper brand that we were able to find that offered a preemie size. Now we are trying the bigger sizes, and though they still hold up great, I'm very disappointed that the bigger sizes don't have the litmus line. Why would you have it on the preemie size and not the larger ones?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for us! Thank You!
customer_reviews.text: Bambo Nature Diapers size 4 (first pic) Andy Pandy size M (second pic) Not even close to Andy Pandy bamboo diapers quality and safeness! It’s very disappointing that they do use chlorine when they say they don’t! I won’t order again! I won’t recommended them at all!
customer_reviews.author: Flower25

customer_reviews.title: Diaper perfection.
customer_reviews.text: The best diapers for absorbency and sensitive skin. I used them on my first child and now on my second. I love them so much I special ordered the preemie size. They have no harsh chemicals, no scent, and absorb a spectacular amount of fluid without leaks. They are also larger than leading competitors and not boxy shaped. Therefore they fit a chubby baby (20lb 4 month old) as well as a skinny one (4lb preemie) well; for a longer period of time. I’ve tried pampers, Huggies, naty baby, honest, seventh generation, and natural bamboo, and Bambo is hands down the winner.
customer_reviews.author: vs

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t decide yet if I like the green or the white package more, I ordering mix in the last month and payed attention that the Diepers in the green package feels a bit smaller than I’m the white one. Both of the packages are very good quality, the white one has the stripe that become blue when the Diepers is wet or dump. I wish they would be a bit bigger in the size
customer_reviews.author: Yulia

customer_reviews.title: Bambo runs a bit large but overall we love these diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bambo runs a bit large but overall we love these diapers! We do wish they had a wetness indicator but we're getting better at feeling whether or not he needs to be changed. These diapers last so long overnight without any leaks! When he sleeps a good 5-6 hours at once, it doesn't leak at all - and it will be HEAVY with urine after that long sleep. Absolutely no rashes once we switched to these. Totally worth the price for the quality AND the environment friendly qualities!
customer_reviews.author: Madilyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Best overall - worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that by getting the most environmentally disposable diaper, they might not be the most absorbent or leak-proof or whatever, but they are perfect. They fit great and no leaking, even overnight. I use size 4 for my 23lb 2-year-old along with the size 5 training pants, which are also very good. These are soft, too.
customer_reviews.author: nutsaboutbooks

customer_reviews.title: VERY Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers I’ve ever purchased for my daughter! My daughter is 18 months and since birth we used an all natural organic diaper brand that we’ve since found out is under investigation for not truly using natural or organic products... I immediately began searching for a new brand and came across these on Amazon with good reviews. At first they were just an emergency replacement but I promise you we have never used a diaper that can hold so much moisture, I mean literally no leakage. I recommend this brand to everyone. The material is SOFT for a baby’s skin, flexible and retain a lot of liquid. You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Auna Berardi

customer_reviews.title: Only bamboo for my bambino!!
customer_reviews.text: What would I do without these diapers? They are the ONLY ones that have left my baby's skin rash free and silky, and he's going on 2 years now. These are hands down the best diapering decision you'll make. I put my boy in one size larger so his skin can breathe at all times, and we still have no leaks!! We love this company!!
customer_reviews.author: GulfGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Diaper. We love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: This are by far the best diapers ever!!! They are not just great absorbing but also they don't have that horrible chemical smell most diapers have. They are soft to your babies skin and also natural! They are expensive but you do not need to change them as often as s Pampers or other diaper brand, so you save money there. We've tried other natural diapers like Second Generation and Babyganics but we always had leaks. We're using Huggies Overnites for the night and they also work great but have chemicals so we just use them during the night. If you can afford it make the effort this diapers are 100% worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Iturriaga

customer_reviews.title: Best nighttime diaper; what we used when we grew out of cloth
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They are the highest rated disposable diaper for both environmental friendliness AS WELL AS absorption. When I open a package of name-brand diapers, the smell of chemicals is overwhelming. Bambo has no scent. I've had my sons in these for about 3 years - first just for night time and then full time after they grew out of cloth diapers. Now one has grown out of them (sadly Bambo pull-ups don't compete with UnderJams for absorbency) and the other still wears them at night and for nap. Not one rash from wearing these diapers. Great fit. Never leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A Daly

customer_reviews.title: Changes to these diapers-not as good!!
customer_reviews.text: Has anyone noticed the diapers change. In green packaging not the purple and now they have a smell and the wet indicator stripe. I have a few older originals and they are definitely thinner. My son leaked through the new one last night too. For this price I’m going to start looking elsewhere, wondering where the transparency is from Bambo on changes??
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this diaper,
customer_reviews.text: except the price! Usually I dock a star for ridiculous pricing, but this product is that good. I use these as a nighttime diaper, they work great for that purpose. A more earth friendly version of other overnights. That's how I use them. So softfor a natural diaper. Love. My son doesn't have super sensitive skin, so I can't speak for that aspect other than to say I have never had an issue with these.
customer_reviews.author: quesolover

customer_reviews.title: We love these diapers
customer_reviews.text: We love these diapers. We got them as our night time diapers because we had heard they were very absorbant. To say the least they are. We use them at nightime with our son, who's a heavy wetter, and they do wonders. We also dream feed so we only change him if he poops so he gets back to sleep and these hold up. Keep in mind they do run large. Our 9lbs 9 oz baby (birth weight) worse the size 1s until he was ~12 lbs. so these won't work if you have a smaller newborn. Also, with the way it's structured I don't think these would work well with babies who are thinner. Our guy is chubbier baby.
customer_reviews.author: Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: The best diapers
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using Bambo Nature diapers since he 1 month old and about 7lbs. He is not 8months and 21lbs and they are still the best diapers we've tried. We've used Pampers Cruisers, Swadlers and Honest and Bambos are our favorites. He never has leaks, rare blowouts (only with extenuating circumstances...), they're soft and scent free. I hate scented diapers. He sleeps 7-7 and the diaper is heavy in the morning but he's happy and dry. I recommend them to everyone! Also, if you add them to subscribe & save you get a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: denvergirl

customer_reviews.title: Holy Grail Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these diapers every since by daughter was a newborn and they are the best! She rarely has had a leak or blowout. She has pretty bad eczema, and I noticed the few times I used other drugstore diapers her skin would become irritated. And I love that these are eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles and Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Super soft absorbent diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers! They are super absorbent and stretchy, I don't have to worry about diapers leaving marks on his chunky thighs anymore. These diapers are soft on my baby's skin and love that they are certified free of harsh and dangerous chemicals, non toxic, hypoallergenic, eco friendly, etc. In fact, these diapers keep my LO dry all through the night as opposed to your traditional ones. Really recommend these diapers to anyone looking to keep their baby's delicate skin as safe and close to natural as possible!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good diaper, kind of pricey.
customer_reviews.text: We like these, but at 24lbs, my son is a bit small/slender, for these. I think they would be a better choice when he gains a bit more weight. My kiddo is a 27mos with an athletic build...I think these would be better on a bigger/pudgier baby. The quality is great. Are they worth the price? I don't know. I find that earth's best and honest company diapers work just as well; earth's best having the best price point. I might try these again when my son is larger, but I am satisfied with earth's best and would probably need to have a bad experience with those to pay twice the price for these.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no smell!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've had no leaks at all and all of my baby's rashes (from our previous diaper brand) are completely gone! They last quite a while and don't get as puffy as other diapers either. Also, there is no chemical smell. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Maegan

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I was expecting too much from the glowing reviews, but I'm going back to Pampers after trying Bambo. I don't like how huge these swell up with the slightest bit of wetness. No leaks, but my baby's skin was very wet every morning and my husband said sometimes he noticed pee puddled in the diaper instead of absorbed. By comparison, when we moved to Pampers Cruisers a size up, my baby no longer had nighttime leaks, the diaper was much less bulky, and her skin was much drier. I do like the environmentally-friendly aspects of these diapers, but the performance just didn't compare with what we're used to from Pampers Swaddlers and now Cruisers.
customer_reviews.author: Jen T.

customer_reviews.title: Great, leak-free diaper that runs LONG
customer_reviews.text: These are so soft and comfy for my baby. They are, however, very long/tall! To keep the diaper flush/tight near my baby's bottom the velcro part comes way, way up her waist above her belly button. She fit into these after she weighed more than the stated weights on the package. We did not experience leaks with these diapers and are overall very satisfied with how they functioned - and love the materials used - just be aware they seem to run a little bit, mostly tall/long, since you can tightened the waist as much as you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Bambo since my baby was born, due to the fact the diapers were the most eco-friendly disposable diaper out there. The hospital gave us Pampers, and the transition from Pampers to Bambo was easy. Bambo was great on his skin, and very absorbent. He could go all night in the same diaper and often, hours into the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie C. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Best eco-friendly diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are great eco-friendly diapers! My son is two and half years old now, but we've used these since he was a baby, and they hold up well to large pees and poops. I love that these are natural eco-friendly and biodegradable! We use about two daily (naptime and bedtime) and with a pack of 6, these last about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: LGraham

product_meta.title: Bambo Nature Eco Friendly Baby Diapers Classic for Sensitive Skin, Size 1 (4-9 lbs), 28 Count (6 Pack)
product_meta.description: Size:Size 1 (168 Count)Bambo Nature baby diapers are considered to be one of the very best disposable diapers in the world. Super soft and highly absorbent, perfect for both day and nighttime use. Our diapers are produced with sustainable manufacturing processes, while ensuring they are free of harmful chemicals and perfumes to minimize the risk of allergies and diaper rash. Bambo Nature diapers have earned the Danish Asthma/Allergy certification, the Nordic Swan Ecolabel, are Dermatologically-tested and FSC-certified. Our diapers are certified free of all known allergens or substances classified as locally irritating, sensitizing, carcinogenic, or mutagenic. Our technologically innovative diapers are thin, yet ultra-absorbent, and feature a fully breathable backsheet. This allows moisture to be wicked away faster, keeping baby’s skin dry and reducing the likelihood of diaper rash. A dry environment, along with the absence of harmful chemicals and allergens, not only prevents, but aids in the healing of diaper rash. Ingredients - Non-woven backsheet (outer side) of polypropylene (PP) and polyethylene (PE). Absorbent of polyacrylate (SAP) and cellulose (ECF fluff). Top sheet of non-woven (PP). Acquisition layer of non-woven (PET/Co-PET). Hook tab fastening system of non-woven (PP/PE). Adhesive made of synthetic rubber—no optical brightener added. Wetness indicator. Elastication made from elastane.
feature_bullets: Our classic, eco-friendly diaper design minimizes the risks of allergy and diaper rash
Ultra absorbent and perfect for both daytime and overnight use
Plush, super soft non-woven backsheet protects baby’s delicate skin
Size 1 fits weights from 4 to 9 pounds

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
